result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Patrick Moon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bond on file in all cases to be applied to amounts due. Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. 

Defendant shall contact the Washington County Jail within 3 days for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Consecutive to: count #1 in 22CF318.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond on file in all cases to be applied to amounts due. Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered. lf probation will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. lf the defendant's probation is revoked with outstanding financial obligations and a jail sentence is ordered at the sentencing after revocation, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall take medications only as prescribed.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew Patrick Moon in court, in custody. Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Andrew Patrick Moon. Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim HLF also present. State confirms victim rights compliance. Argument by counsel on sentence.  Defense stipulates to having bond posted in all cases, including the dismissed and read in cases, to be applied to amounts due in this case and 22CF375. Statements by Defendant. Defendant sentenced.

Defendant Andrew Patrick Moon in court, in custody. Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Andrew Patrick Moon. Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim HLF present in person. Agreement reached for pleas with counsel free to argue sentence. Def waives preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and binds def over for trial. State to file information within 48 hrs. Def pleads guilty to count #1 and #4; def is convicted. Counts #2, #3 and #5 are dismissed and read in. Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Case set for anticipated resolution in Br 2 on Aug 22, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Robert Buckett.  Court finds audio/video is working sufficient.  Recusal/waiver letter filed by Court.  Counsel's first appearance.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and recusal/waiver issue.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
No contact with H.L.F. Maintain absolute sobriety.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew Patrick Moon appeared by video, in custody at Washington Co. Jail.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran appeared by video for Andrew Patrick Moon.  (22CF318 Br. 3; 22CF305 & 22CM255 Br. 2)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  Defendant consents to appearing by video.  Court discloses possible conflict and defendant waives recusal for purposes of this hearing.  Atty. Beltran and State do not object to continuing with the hearing today.  State requests $7,500.00 cash bond.  Atty. Beltran requests $4,000.00 cash bond.  Court orders $4,000.00 cash bond. 
 Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
